description.en: The target group of the course is Master students, PhD students, who are interested in computational imaging technologies, with a focus on  bioimaging. First part of the course is to provide theoretical background for computational imaging. Second part of the course is to develop next generation computational imaging systems for the applications to computer graphics, remote sensing and robotics vision.
description.et: Kursuse sihtrühmaks on magistrandid, doktorandid, kes tunnevad huvi arvutusliku pildistamise tehnoloogiate vastu, fookusega biokujutisel. Kursuse esimene osa on anda teoreetiline taust arvutusliku pildistamise jaoks. Kursuse teine osa on järgmise põlvkonna arvutusliku kujutise süsteemide arendamine arvutigraafika, kaugseire ja robootika nägemise rakenduste jaoks.

objectives.en: The aim of this course is to provide a theoretical and practical of computational imaging with applications focusing on solving inverse problems in imaging, such as denoising, deconvolution, single-pixel imaging.
objectives.et: Selle kursuse eesmärk on anda teoreetilisi ja praktilisi teadmisi järgmise põlvkonna arvutustööst rakendustega, mis keskenduvad pildistamise pöördprobleemide lahendamisele, nagu müra vähendamise, dekonvolutsiooni, ühe piksliga pildistamisele.

objectives.en: - The course introduces modern human visual perception, digital cameras and ISPs, Light field imaging, wave optics.
objectives.et: - Kursusel tutvustatakse tänapäeva inimese visuaalset taju, digikaameraid ja Interneti-teenuse pakkujaid, valgusvälja kujutist, laineoptikat.

objectives.en: - The second goal is to teach classic algorithms, modern data-driven approaches using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and Vision Transformers (ViT), and  proximal gradient methods, that combine formal optimization with  Deep Learning Methods. The homeworks will be given based on programming and image processing in Python.
objectives.et: - Teine eesmärk on õpetada klassikalisi algoritme, kaasaegseid andmepõhiseid lähenemisviise, mis kasutavad konvolutsioonilisi närvivõrke (CNN) ja Vision Transformers (ViT) ning proksimaalse gradiendi meetodeid, mis ühendavad formaalse optimeerimise süvaõppemeetoditega. Kodutööd antakse Pythonis programmeerimise ja pilditöötluse põhjal.

objectives.en: - The third goal is to develop next-generation  computation and display systems. These systems will have applications in consumer electronics, microscopy,  human interaction, health, optics.
objectives.et: - Kolmas eesmärk on arendada järgmise põlvkonna arvutus- ja kuvamissüsteeme. Nendel süsteemidel on rakendusi olmeelektroonikas, mikroskoopias, inimestevahelises suhtluses, tervises ja optikas.

learning_outcomes.en: After passing the course the student will acquire:
- Acquire theoretical knowledge and practical knowledge in computational imaging with focus on bio-imaging.
learning_outcomes.et: - Omandada teoreetilised ja praktilised teadmised arvutuslikust kujutisest koos biopildistamise dokumentidega.

learning_outcomes.en: - Develop next-generation computational imaging systems for imaging around corners and through scattering media etc.
learning_outcomes.et: - Arendada välja järgmise põlvkonna arvutuslikud pildistamissüsteemid nurkade ümber ja hajutava andmekandja jne pildistamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: - Develop machine learning algorithms for representing and processing signals.
learning_outcomes.et: - Arendada masinõppe algoritme signaalide esitamiseks ja töötlemiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: - Applications to computer graphics, remote sensing, and robotic vision

independent_work.et: The student is expected to work on the applied/research project agreed-upon with the supervisor. The supervisor will provide sufficient consultation to allow the student to successfully finish the project.

grade_preconditions.et: 16 points from Homeworks to take the final examination.

grade_evaluation.et: In order to pass the course, the student must have at least 51 points (grade E) in total and get at least 50% from the Homeworks, Project, and Final Exam (16 homeworks points,  20 points from the project and 15 points from Final Exam).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
